fund: Free-form text strings containing investment-fund names/identifiers; categorical values that may include words, spaces, capitalisation, numerals or Roman numerals, and optional parenthetical “AKA …” alternate names. No fixed standard beyond conventional fund-naming syntax (e.g., “[Manager] [Fund] [Series/Number]”).
year: ISO-8601 date field storing the first day of each fiscal year (always “YYYY-01-01”, e.g., 2023-01-01); values are discrete annual points on the Gregorian calendar used as fiscal-year identifiers.
cash_out_flow: Numeric cash amount stored as a high-precision DECIMAL/NUMERIC field (e.g., ‑3150648.0000), bearing a leading “-” sign for outflows and always showing four digits after the decimal; NULL represents missing data.
cash_in_flow: Numeric field storing positive monetary amounts in USD as fixed-precision decimals with up to 4 digits after the decimal point (e.g., 1 102 4029.0000); NULL indicates no data.
net_cash_flow: Signed monetary amount stored as a decimal number with exactly four-place precision (e.g., -12024167.0000), allowing both positive and negative values; continuous numeric field, nullable (None for missing).
